Townsends of Arkansas
625 South Allen Street
Batesville, AR  72501


Townsends? chemical accident prevention and emergency response policies for ammonia refrigeration involve the development of this Risk Management Program and Plan (?RMP?) which has a primary objective of preventing an accidental  release of ammonia, and in the event there is one, minimize the consequences of a release.  

The stationary source subject to this RMP is Townsends? poultry processing facility located in Batesville, AR.  The facility has two interconnected refrigeration systems which contain anhydrous ammonia, a regulated substance under the RMP regulations.

The location has prepared a worst case release scenario, with distance to the toxic endpoint, using the ALOHA air dispersion modeling software. The alternate case release scenario, with distance to the toxic endpoint, was prepared using the RMPComp software. 

In accordance with RMP regulations, the general accidental release prevention program for this facility?s ammonia refrigeration system is comprised of the following components: process safety information, process hazard analysis, operating procedures, operator training, procedures for maintaining mechanical integrity, procedures for managing system changes, pre-start up safety review procedures, procedures for investigating release incidents, and hot work permit protocols.  This program was developed with the participation of the affected employees, and will be periodically audited for compliance required by the RMP regulations.  In addition, the facility has in place procedures for notifying contractors and their employees of the hazards of the system.  Chemical specific prevention steps are included within the program, including engineering and administration controls designed to prevent and minimize accidental releases.  

In the five years preceding the submittal of this RMP, this facility has not had any accidental releases of ammonia which have resulted in deaths, injuri

es, or significant property damage on site, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.  

This facility has developed an Emergency Action Plan which addresses accidental release of hazardous substances and has coordinated with the Independence County Local Emergency Planning Commission (?LEPC?).  The facility is included in the LEPC?s community emergency response plan. 

The process hazard analysis reports prepared for the facility in May 1999 identified various recommendations to minimize the risk of accidental releases and improve safety related to the ammonia refrigeration system.  All of the recommendations from the 1999 PHA have been resolved.
